name: Best Motion Picture of the Year
normalized_name: Best Motion Picture of the Year

candidates.notes: 12 Years a Slave (2013) became the first film directed and produced by a black filmmaker (Steve McQueen) and also the first to be written by an African-American (John Ridley) to win the Academy Award for Best Motion Picture of the Year.

name: Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role

name: Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role

candidates.notes: Alfonso Cuarón became the first Hispanic and Mexican to win the Academy Award for Best Director.

name: Best Achievement in Music Written for Motion Pictures, Original Song
normalized_name: Best Achievement in Music Written for Motion Pictures (Original Song)

candidates.notes: Song: "Alone Yet Not Alone" [NOTE: THIS IS NOT AN OFFICIAL NOMINATION. After the nominations were announced on January 16, 2014, it was determined that Mr. Broughton had taken actions in promoting the song that were inconsistent with the Academy's campaign regulations. The Board of Governors voted to rescind the nomination on January 29, and only four songs were included on the final ballot.]

name: Best Achievement in Music Written for Motion Pictures, Original Score
normalized_name: Best Achievement in Music Written for Motion Pictures (Original Score)
